question.title: {"sections": [{"spans": [{"text": "Is the USA the most racist country in the world?", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}]}

answer.content: {"sections": [{"spans": [{"text": "As an immigrant, I\u2019m going to say that the answer to this is a strong no.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "In the US, a large segment of the population is aware that racism is bad. Even people who hold racist opinions have a negative opinion of racism. This is why so many of them feel the need to preface their comments with \u201cI\u2019m not racist, but\u2026\u201d", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "This kind of awareness that bigotry in the abstract, as opposed to bigotry directed against one\u2019s own group, is a bad thing is really rare elsewhere in the world. The kind of prejudice that you encounter on a daily basis in many countries of the world has no sense of shame. People will be subjected to intense mockery for nothing more than having an accent. People will casually mention in polite society that immigrants from Haiti or Lebanon or Liberia or Ghana or Nigeria or Poland or Korea or India or Turkey or wherever else are ruining their host nation, and they\u2019ll do so without batting an eye. Legally enforced discrimination will be placed on foreign national and their descendants without ever being questioned. If a person from an immigrant community commits a crime, there can easily be riots against all members of that community.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "In the US, it was possible for a Black man to be president! It wasn\u2019t accepted by all the population, to be sure, but you\u2019re not going to see that happen in France, Germany, Brazil, or Japan any time soon.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "The racism that exists in the US generally takes two forms:", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "The criminal justice system polices, fines, shoots, arrests, convicts, imprisons, and executes Blacks at a rate disproportionate to the Black crime rate, in what amounts to a tax on melanin. Large segments of the White population are entirely unsympathetic to complaints from Black people, which means that these policies will continue for decades to come.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "unordered-list", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Success in many professions depends on taking advantage of networking opportunities. Many darker-hued people are less likely to be afforded such opportunities, via a combination of the fact that they belong to a race whose members are poorer as a whole and the fact that they\u2019re not as likely to be invited to the social gatherings where business deals and decisions about promotion are informally decided.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "unordered-list", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "There are other forms of racism, of course, but these are the two that have an impact on a person\u2019s socioeconomic prospects.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "I would say that, compared to what I have observed and read about elsewhere, American structural racism is relatively mild. And face-to-face racism is largely frowned upon. People can even lose their job for making a racist comment on air. You\u2019re certainly not going to see that in very many other places. Of course, the election of Trump shows that large segments of the American public are not bothered by racism. But, as a non-White immigrant, I feel that I am treated much better here than I would be in most other places.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}]}
